title: Victorian Alps farm added to Toorak mansion offering
text:
The Gunter family has put its grazing property in the foothills of the Victorian Alps up for sale, to add to its offering of one of Toorak's prized mansions.

Ben Cruachan Pastoral at 3 Huggetts Road in Maffra West is set across 1,281 hectares and 18 titles and boasts a prominent homestead with panoramic views of the surrounding mountain ranges.

It is part of the estate of urologist Dr David Gunter, who died in 2015, and his wife Judy, who died in December.

Ben Cruachan Pastoral is nestled in the foothills of the Alpine ranges.

The couple, who had seven children, were prominent Melbourne socialites, hosting musical performances, artistic events and even prime ministers at their 14-bedroom Italianate Toorak mansion "Carmyle", which they bought in 1968.

Price expectations for Ben Cruachan are around $3.3 million with Elders Melbourne's Anthony Stevens the appointed agent.
description: Ben Cruachan Pastoral is part of the estate of the urologist David Gunter, who died 2015, and his wife Judy, who died in December.
